metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3710 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The VGA module in QEMU improperly performs bounds checking on banked accessto video memory, which allows local guest OS administrators to executearbitrary code on the host by changing access modes after setting the bankregister, aka the "Dark Portal" issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3710` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-user - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
qemu-utils - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6

xenstore-utils - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.24').
xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6').
